definitions.definition: To do or say again (and again).
examples: The scientists repeated the experiment in order to confirm the result.
I'll tell you my secret, but first promise me you won't repeat it to anyone else!
I don't mind talking about the incident, but one gets tired of repeating themself after the hundredth time.
A day like that has not yet repeated itself.

definitions.definition: To echo the words of (a person).
To strike the hours, as a watch does.
To make trial of again; to undergo or encounter again.
To repay or refund (an excess received).
To call in a previous artillery fire mission with the same ammunition and method either on the coordinates or adjusted either because destruction of the target was insufficient or missed.
examples: Use "say again" instead of repeat on the radio. Repeat will bring in artillery fire.

definitions.definition: To commit fraud in an election by voting more than once for the same candidate .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To do or say again (and again).
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , medicine , pharmacy ) To refill (a prescription ).
( transitive ) To echo the words of (a person).
( intransitive ) To strike the hours, as a watch does.
( obsolete ) To make trial of again; to undergo or encounter again.
( law , Scotland ) To repay or refund (an excess received).

( procedure word , military ) To call in a previous artillery fire mission with the same ammunition and method either on the coordinates or adjusted either because destruction of the target was insufficient or missed.
To commit fraud in an election by voting more than once for the same candidate .
